author: hurricanem0lly
content:
How serious of a threat is this?

https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/bitcoin-cryptocurrencies-cyberattack-ransomware-btc-biden-administration-investigating-2021-6-1030495685

author: hurricanem0lly
content: I've seen Robert Reich and The New Republic calling for banning of crypto on environmental and security grounds, which indicates to me that the mainstream American left is going to be hostile towards the space moving forward.

author: hurricanem0lly
content: The only reason I see to be sanguine is that mainstream American left sucks at politics, but the space is in trouble if they start to drive a consensus with people in the center.

author: hurricanem0lly
content: I feel like the merge defangs the environmental concerns which would improve the case for a blanket ban, but it seems to me that the only (apparent to the likes of Rob Reich and Paul Krugman) way to stop `hackers` is to nuke the space as a whole

author: sky.cactus
content: This is an R&D discord server, and while this is the <#595721451651465227> channel it is meant to still be focused on research and development topics that aren't otherwise covered by one of the other channels.  Generally any kind of political discussion (especially geo-political) is avoided here.

author: hurricanem0lly
content: Where would be an appropriate place to host open discussion of political economy?

content: Geopolitics isn't generally known for thoughtful discourse.  ðŸ˜¬

author: hurricanem0lly

author: void.xyz
content: The amount of bias in this article towards shaming cryptocurrencies as something only utilized by bad actors is insane

author: hurricanem0lly
content: and as ETH matures, its political implications will start to produce practical problems

author: hurricanem0lly
content: I'm actually writing a long form piece about this now aimed primarily at lawyers

author: sky.cactus
content: There is basically nothing that could happen in global politics that would change my position on Proof of Stake or The Merge.  I'll keep contributing/building toward what I think is a social good regardless of what some talking head running a country says.

author: sky.cactus
content: I may *move* if a talking head starts to look threatening to my personal safety, but I wouldn't stop building or change what I was building.

author: hurricanem0lly
content: Like I said, I'm in the process of writing a deep dive on the political-economic implications, with the goal of sparking serious interdisciplinary discourse between coders (which I am) and lawyers on this subject.

author: hurricanem0lly
content: Because it would be deeply tragic if we hit 100K-1M tps and scale into a robust defi ecosystem, only for governments to wig out and go to war with the space.

author: hurricanem0lly
content: And based on about a month or so of lurking here, I think escape velocity will be hit sooner rather than later

author: schattian
content:
Not sure where to ask that, so I'll leave it here
Is there any way to track changes in the protocol (i.e EIPs)?
When digging deep in the details I see a lot of times issues between the documented and actual, consequence of the fast-pace this is having. 
So most of the time when I'm in doubt about details I always go to see a random important client, but it can be biased.
Anyone has any other pragmatic approach to tackle this issue?
